headline: Why E.P.A. Workers Make Money From Pollution, and How to Fix It
abstract: The Thrift Savings Plan for retirement savings mirrors index funds that invest in such stocks. Thereâ€™s a fix.
lead_paragraph: Many people who work for the Office of the Surgeon General have exposure to tobacco stocks. At the Environmental Protection Agency, scientists make money when polluters do well. And Justice Department lawyers who keep weapons off the streets stake some of their net worth on retailers that sell guns.
